questions.text: Which of the following best describes cloud computing according to AWS?

options.text: On-demand delivery of IT resources over the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing
Purchasing physical servers and storing them in your own data center
Using only free-tier services from cloud providers
Renting dedicated hardware from a data center without internet access

questions.explanation: Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of IT resources over the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing. Instead of buying, owning, and maintaining physical data centers and servers, you can access technology services, such as computing power, storage, and databases, on an as-needed basis from a cloud provider like AWS.

questions.text: What are the six advantages of cloud computing as defined by AWS?

options.text: Trade fixed expense for variable expense
Benefit from massive economies of scale
Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers

questions.explanation: AWS defines six advantages of cloud computing: 1) Trade fixed expense for variable expense, 2) Benefit from massive economies of scale, 3) Stop guessing capacity, 4) Increase speed and agility, 5) Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers, and 6) Go global in minutes.

questions.text: Which AWS service is used to manage access to AWS resources using policies?
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is used to securely control access to AWS resources. IAM policies define permissions that specify which actions are allowed or denied on specific resources.

questions.text: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is the customer's responsibility?
questions.explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, AWS is responsible for security 'of' the cloud (infrastructure), while customers are responsible for security 'in' the cloud. This includes configuring security groups, network ACLs, IAM policies, and encrypting data.

questions.text: Which AWS service provides a virtual server for running applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provides scalable computing capacity in the cloud. It allows you to launch virtual servers, configure security and networking, and manage storage.

questions.text: Which AWS service is a managed relational database service?
questions.explanation: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient and resizable capacity while automating time-consuming administration tasks.

questions.text: Which of the following is an object storage service in AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance. It's designed for 99.999999999% (11 9's) of durability.

questions.text: Which AWS pricing model allows you to pay for compute capacity by the hour or second with no long-term commitments?
questions.explanation: On-Demand Instances let you pay for compute capacity by the hour or second (minimum of 60 seconds) with no long-term commitments. This frees you from the costs and complexities of planning, purchasing, and maintaining hardware.

questions.text: Which AWS service helps you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer has an easy-to-use interface that lets you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time. You can create custom reports that analyze cost and usage data.

questions.text: True or False: AWS operates data centers in multiple geographic locations called Regions.
questions.explanation: True. AWS has the concept of a Region, which is a physical location around the world where AWS clusters data centers. Each AWS Region consists of multiple, isolated, and physically separate Availability Zones within a geographic area.
